Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Notification \No`ti*fi*ca"tion\, n. [Cf. F. notification. See {Notify}.] 1. The act of notifying, or giving notice; the act of making known; especially, the act of giving official notice or information to the public or to individuals, corporations, companies, or societies, by words, by writing, or by other means. [1913 Webster]
2. Notice given in words or writing, or by signs. [1913 Webster]
3. The writing which communicates information; an advertisement, or citation, etc. [1913 Webster]

notification n 1: an accusation of crime made by a grand jury on its own initiative [syn: {presentment}] 2: informing by words [syn: {telling}, {apprisal}] 3: a request for payment; "the notification stated the grace period and the penalties for defaulting" [syn: {notice}]
